title: Tristana needs to be given a proper niche

replies.body: AP trist had a niche. Then Riot removed AP trist because they don't want players having fun, just like with AP Yi.
AP trist was hell to play against and unhealthy for the game
https://youtu.be/kvlQKKEhVKc?t=31
They removed it because players liked having fun. There was nothing fun about walking into lane to get DFG+E+R'd for your entire health bar by point and click abilities.

Or, they wanted players to have fun because going against them wasn't fun.

That said, I do miss AP trist. It was hella fun :(

Tristana has a niche.  She's the safest Marksman and arguably the best teamfighter of the Marksmen.

She also has strong tools to be a lane bully against anyone that isn't a straight lane bully ( {{champion:236}} ) and even then the math might show up pretty good for her.

for a hyper carry her team fighting really isn't that good {{champion:29}} shreds a team from farther and obliderates both front and backline{{champion:96}} will literally kill anything that comes in his range in seconds, {{champion:222}} has the aoe of the rockets and her resets make her insanely good in fights if her blood starts pumping the only one she beats is vayne, who trades teamfighting for far better safety, 

of the marksmen with mobility she is really low on the safety list {{champion:81}} has a blink and can stay farther away, {{champion:236}} only needs to proc his passive to keep himself mobile {{champion:67}} has a very low cooldown on her dash {{champion:429}} is kalista {{champion:51}} has long range for most of the game and can also use her traps for safety.

her laning is okay, but she suffers from the same mid game drop as {{champion:51}} but never got to benefit from the ability to poke out the enemy lane and have a good chance to snowball

Homie, you are measuring teamfighting solely through killing the enemy team.

Jinx rockets are definitely sweet but I can see the AS debuff she gets from them resulting in her dealing less damage than Tristana, especially with Q active.  Her self-peel is also pretty garbage when you compare her to Tristana.

{{champion:29}} has a strong ult for teamfighting but only gets 6 shots and needs the enemy team balled up, then he's back down to his normal, very unsafe range.  He also has terrible tools for self-peel when compared to Tristana.

I'm pretty sure {{champion:96}} will out dmg Tristana with his W up but with that down he has extremely limited tools in the fight or if things get unorthodox.  Tristana will deal constant damage at a ridiculous range and her Q should make her damage comparable to Koggle when shit gets real.  He also has terrible tools for self-peel when compared to Tristana.

Lucian, Vayne, Caitlin, Ezreal and Kalista all have garbage dash ranges when compared to Tristana.  A dedicated dive will catch them.  Caitlin traps are garbage and are 100% reliant on being a better player than your opponent rather than their own inherent strength unless you've been allowed to set them up before the fight.  Caitlin's safety is going to be reliant on keeping opponents on the outskirts of her range.  One flank and she's a goner.

Also it should be noted that her strong self-peel also doubles as some sick MLG big plays.

How the flying hells bells is Tristana the best teamfighting ADC, how is she a lane bully in any way with that heavily telegraphed E and no upfront burst damage?! 

And Caitlyn is just as if not more safe than Tristana while not giving up damage for being safe. If Tristana W's away or ults someone she puts herself or them outside of her range of influence, Caitlyn's traps and E can save her AND allow her to retaliate against her enemy.

She is arguably the best teamfighting Marksman because of her long range, huge AS steriod, and the dmg on her E combined with her unrivalled self-peel.

Telegraphing is perfectly fine, especially when the enemy has no choice but to eat the dmg.  Combined with her W she has horrifying potential to all in and burst the enemy into oblivion.

Your comments about Caitlyn's safety are factually incorrect, especially when you consider that Tristana's range rival's Caitlyn around lvl 9 and outmatches it @ lvl 16.

Caitlyn's traps are garbage and 100% reliant on you outplaying your opponent as opposed to their own inherent strength unless you had time to set up before hand.  E tricks are nice in lane but cannot compare to Tristana in terms of safety and play making potential.

> [{quoted}](name=Tobias Brackner,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RHATwHNy,comment-id=000c00020000,timestamp=2017-05-30T21:12:56.396+0000)
>
> She is arguably the best teamfighting Marksman because of her long range, huge AS steriod, and the dmg on her E combined with her unrivalled self-peel.

Her "long range" only ever gets higher than Caitlyn's at level 16, most games end before an ADC gets to level 16 and long range doesn't mean anything if you don't have the damage to go with it, her AS steroid hurts her more than it helps her because her base AS has been made so low in compensation for it so she has brief moments of having high attack speed only for her to lose it all when her Q goes on cd.

Her E does damage, not good damage but it does damage, and nothing about it is all that high nor is it a good teamfight skill, it's actually a god awful teamfight skill because someone with her E on them can just rotate out of her range and she can't chase them because she'll end up running into their team, if she is forced to switch targets then she loses her main source of damage. And I've spoken about how her self peel is a doubled edged sword elsewhere in this thread so I'll just quote it, "The problem with her self peel is simple. If Jinx throws out her E and an enemy runs into it, Jinx has a second or two to auto them or for her team to follow up on that CC. If Tristana jumps from someone she's now safe but she also has no retaliation, if she ults them then she's not only pushing them out of her face but away from herself and her allies attacking them.

That's the huge double edged sword to Tristana's safety, yes she has safety but unlike every other ADC, her safety comes at the cost of her losing damage."

Vayne's Q and Lucian's E are infinitely superior to Tristana's W, having low cd short ranged dashes means you can reposition yourself over and over again while still being able to deal damage back and allows you to dodge multiple abilities throughout a fight. A long CD long range dash makes it so if Tristana uses it to get away from someone that could have killed her she may as well have died anyway because that person has already made her leave the fight, she also loses a large part of her damage for using her W to just get away and if she walks back into range she risks having the same thing happen again but now her W is on CD. Her ult pushes someone off her but it also pushes them away from her team so they can't follow up and CC or damage them.

> 
> Telegraphing is perfectly fine, especially when the enemy has no choice but to eat the dmg.  Combined with her W she has horrifying potential to all in and burst the enemy into oblivion.

Potential is all it is. On paper she has a lot of damage for an all in but in practice it means she has to take far more risks to deal her damage that other ADC's can deal without having to suicidally dive the enemy team. The play pattern especially doesn't work since Tristana's damage is tied to her autos and so she can't build like the more burst heavy marksmen.

> 
> Your comments about Caitlyn's safety are factually incorrect, especially when you consider that Tristana's range rival's Caitlyn around lvl 9 and outmatches it @ lvl 16.

How does that make my statement factually incorrect? Until level 16, which again, barely ever happens for a marksman, you could have picked Caitlyn and gotten more range than Tristana while also having a better lanning phase. Tristana takes so long to get high range that by the time she does it isn't a factor in how the game will go because that has already been decided long beforehand.

> 
> Caitlyn's traps are garbage and 100% reliant on you outplaying your opponent as opposed to their own inherent strength unless you had time to set up before hand.  E tricks are nice in lane but cannot compare to Tristana in terms of safety and play making potential.

Give me an argument for that, not just your opinion, explain to me how Tristana's kit is better than Caitlyn's in an actual situation.

Tristana's W is far far worse than Caitlyn's E. Tristana's W and Caitlyn's E both apply a slow, they both deal damage, and they are both a dash. Tristana's W requires her to jump ONTO an enemy to deal the damage and apply the slow which puts her within their range of power just as much as her own so you have to either choose to use it to escape someone or use it to deal damage. Caitlyn's E on the other hand moves her away from her enemy and fires a skillshot that slows, putting her into a safe position, and deals its own damage and procs her passive so she can hit them with an auto for a large amount of damage.

Caitlyn's E has all the benefits of Tristana's W without the drawbacks, it makes her safe but it doesn't sacrifice her damage while doing so and the damage doesn't require her to do one of the worst things a marksman can do which is go out of position.

> [{quoted}](name=SpecterVonBaren,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RHATwHNy,comment-id=000c000200000000,timestamp=2017-05-30T22:39:30.308+0000)
>
> Her "long range" only ever gets higher than Caitlyn's at level 16, most games end before an ADC gets to level 16 and long range doesn't mean anything if you don't have the damage to go with it, her AS steroid hurts her more than it helps her because her base AS has been made so low in compensation for it so she has brief moments of having high attack speed only for her to lose it all when her Q goes on cd.

She has a decently long range and plenty of damage; yes, her CD on her Q does gate her damage but she still does a decent amount without it as with a Runaan's, BoRK, and Greaves at level 14 her AS hovers(without Q) at 1.56. This is running a rune page with 16% AS, which is at least my standard Tristana page. :/ If you run triple crit instead and go Runaan's and PD, the AS is 1.69 which is still not awful. Her Q nearly sets her at the Cap at level 14 and completely maxed out. Cait running the same Triple Crit set up and the same Runes(which I usually wouldn't run on Cait TBH), only has 1.70 AS. There's literally only .01 difference at level 14 between the two. And then Trist activates Q and actually gets a massive buff.

> Her E does damage, not good damage but it does damage, and nothing about it is all that high nor is it a good teamfight skill, it's actually a god awful teamfight skill because someone with her E on them can just rotate out of her range and she can't chase them because she'll end up running into their team, if she is forced to switch targets then she loses her main source of damage. And I've spoken about how her self peel is a doubled edged sword elsewhere in this thread so I'll just quote it, "The problem with her self peel is simple. If Jinx throws out her E and an enemy runs into it, Jinx has a second or two to auto them or for her team to follow up on that CC. If Tristana jumps from someone she's now safe but she also has no retaliation, if she ults them then she's not only pushing them out of her face but away from herself and her allies attacking them.

Her E isn't intended as a teamfight tool in the first place. Its there for trades in lane and later as a tool to assassinate some squishy too stupid to have warded or be with their team. Its a burst tool for 1v1's and while it can be useful if the enemy team engages and/or is CC'd in teamfights, Tristana's main source of teamfighting power comes from her Q, Hop, and Ult. And while her self peel gets her away and out her own AA range, 9 times out of 10 if she's been hard engaged on, she can't be that close anymore anyway; she's squishy like any other ADC and if someone is already on top of her, its probably too late. So sure, while Jinx's E *could* allow her to AA them for a few more seconds, if she's getting dove it doesn't matter. She's probably already dead because that E isn't very good for peel in general. :/ Its acts like a bigger Caitlyn trap really. Instead, what Tristana's W and Ult provide instead is a way to stall things out. She can hop away or ult them away and then actually live long enough maybe for her to support or the tank to come in and CC the threat for her. At that point, she can just walk back in and continue to deal damage which is what I often times will use my Jump and Ult for instead.


> Vayne's Q and Lucian's E are infinitely superior to Tristana's W, having low cd short ranged dashes means you can reposition yourself over and over again while still being able to deal damage back and allows you to dodge multiple abilities throughout a fight. A long CD long range dash makes it so if Tristana uses it to get away from someone that could have killed her she may as well have died anyway because that person has already made her leave the fight, she also loses a large part of her damage for using her W to just get away and if she walks back into range she risks having the same thing happen again but now her W is on CD. Her ult pushes someone off her but it also pushes them away from her team so they can't follow up and CC or damage them.
> 

Both Vayne and Lucian have short range so their dashes *should* be short CDs. And Lucian's is actually *not* all that short. Lucian's dash actively rewards him for kiting back with it by getting a lower CD the more times he procs his passive. Its not actually a short CD. Vayne's tumble is honestly, too free a spell in my opinion and needs a longer CD when you consider it can also give her stealth. Vayne is also extremely easy to dive and CC and also has a knock back, like Tristana's, that could be considered counter intuitive. Also, 9 times out of ten, if a Tristana is ulting someone away, they were probably already coming at her from an angle in which her team couldn't react and that would have probably honestly gib'd any ADC less mobile than her. :/

> Potential is all it is. On paper she has a lot of damage for an all in but in practice it means she has to take far more risks to deal her damage that other ADC's can deal without having to suicidally dive the enemy team. The play pattern especially doesn't work since Tristana's damage is tied to her autos and so she can't build like the more burst heavy marksmen.
> 

I don't feel like Marksmen *should* be bursting at all. I feel like that's what's wrong with ADCs right now is that they are "bursting" when they should be "DPSing." That is what Tristana does and she never has to suicidally *dive* the enemy team to do it. Only stupid, bad Tristana's EVER use their jump offensively in teamfights; why in the hell would you *ever* jump forward into a team?! This applies to not only Tristana but to Lucian and Vayne as well. Why the *hell* would you ever aggressively dash or jump or tumble into the enemy team? A Tristana who is good saves her jump to get her out of trouble in teamfights; not to leap in and *find* it. Anyone doing that on Tristana is an idiot.

> How does that make my statement factually incorrect? Until level 16, which again, barely ever happens for a marksman, you could have picked Caitlyn and gotten more range than Tristana while also having a better lanning phase. Tristana takes so long to get high range that by the time she does it isn't a factor in how the game will go because that has already been decided long beforehand.
> 

I get level 16 fairly regularly on Marksmen. After laning ends, when there isn't a teamfight, the ADC should honestly be in the side lanes solo catching waves which will make them catch up and level fairly quickly. Just for proof, here are a handful of games I got level 16 and up in just in the last few days: http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2510926561/228066420?tab=overview
http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2512394937/228066420?tab=overview
http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2512191203/228066420?tab=overview
http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2511967136/228066420?tab=overview
http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2510926561/228066420?tab=overview
http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2509895871/228066420?tab=overview

I'll agree that her passive should give her more range per level but saying that it barely ever happens that an AD gets level 16 in a game is bullshit. 

> Give me an argument for that, not just your opinion, explain to me how Tristana's kit is better than Caitlyn's in an actual situation.
> 
> Tristana's W is far far worse than Caitlyn's E. Tristana's W and Caitlyn's E both apply a slow, they both deal damage, and they are both a dash. Tristana's W requires her to jump ONTO an enemy to deal the damage and apply the slow which puts her within their range of power just as much as her own so you have to either choose to use it to escape someone or use it to deal damage. Caitlyn's E on the other hand moves her away from her enemy and fires a skillshot that slows, putting her into a safe position, and deals its own damage and procs her passive so she can hit them with an auto for a large amount of damage.
> 

Caitlyn's kit is worse than Tristana's because she doesn't even *have* an AS steroid anywhere in it. Cait's net is short ranged and very poorly designed as an *actual* means of escape which is why most Caits don't actually use the net as a means to escape but instead as an option to do more damage. :/ So many Caits in lane or in teamfights, use Net specifically to pull off the Net into Q into Headshot. Furthermore, the net wouldn't even viably provide her with extra damage because it gives Caitlyn increased range. Meaning they took an ability that originally was intended as an escape mechanism and turned it into an extra damage source. Caitlyn's net is actually a terrible safety and self peel tool that, sure, keeps her in range to continue doing damage(for one AA), but it also keeps her in range of still being blown up and it also has a fairly long CD. Tristana can out put shittons of damage with her high range right up until the last second and the hop away. If she's being chased, the enemy will naturally come back into her AA range, allowing her to continue DPSing. I often times will hold my jump so that I can stand close enough to continue to do damage and the jump away right as they're about to get on top of me. :/ 

In all honesty, however, comparing Cait and Tristana are like comparing Apples to Oranges. Cait's not *meant* to be carrying late game; she's meant to be falling off and originally was intended as an ADC who did well in lane, had a meh sort of mid game and wasn't supposed to continue scaling massively well into the late game. Cait is currently not even in *her* right role, which is why she's being nerfed.
I love you <3

> [{quoted}](name=Tobias Brackner,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RHATwHNy,comment-id=000c00020000000000000000,timestamp=2017-05-31T19:36:27.540+0000)
>
> I love you <3

<3 Glad I could step in and get solid points across about how Caitlyn is *flatly* not better than Tristana and performs a completely separate niche. I gotta stick up for my favorite yordle and her fellow fans after all.

In all seriousness though, Tristana *does* need a buff. Her kit is clunky and extremely gated fairly often and with Draven and Lucian and Cait(all who do better than her in lane) being so popular along with Twitch(who is just out scaling everyone), she's struggling to make it past her meh early game, her awful mid, and into the amazing Late she has. :/
Honestly I feel that she is a counter for Caitlyn in lane while having tools to put hurt on Draven/Lucian through outplay.

> [{quoted}](name=Tobias Brackner,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RHATwHNy,comment-id=000c0002000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-06-01T08:03:11.799+0000)
>
> Honestly I feel that she is a counter for Caitlyn in lane while having tools to put hurt on Draven/Lucian through outplay.

She can handle Cait in lane only if her support is aggressive with her. Another problem of Tristana's is she relies fairly heavily on her support for laning phase; she can't easily make plays in lane because she doesn't have any effective means of poking. Her AA range is still shorter than Caits, Lucian's Q can hit her through minions and, honestly, outside of her AA range, and Draven's AA's hit far harder than hers ever could early game. With Cait, she requires a support who will be aggressive with her so that she doesn't get focused down; probably a Karma or, hell, even a Sona or Zyra if there isn't a Thresh or Blitz with the Cait. With Lucian, she has to dodge the Q and stay out of his dash range; basically, to take trades with Lucian, you have to watch his CDs. With Draven... there's honestly very little she *can* do. He does more damage than her so taking trades is a TERRIBLE idea. If she has an aggressive, poke heavy support that can wittle the Draven down so she has a health/pot advantage, then maybe, but 9 times out of 10, on equal skill and at level 1, Draven wins all trades just due to how much damage he has. That being said, if she can survive against any of these three and not fall *too* far behind, she does out scale them later.

Yeah Lucian and Draven are going to be rough but I feel she has the tools to turn a small mistake on their part into a huge trade for her favor although this will want a really good support at her side.

W/ Caitlyn I feel that W E Q will win the lane for Tristana, especially if you dodge the net.
Yeah, she has great self-peel capabilities. I think her kit is already extremely good, she is just not favored by the meta.

Pls no more "But muh uniqueness reworks" tris is the ONLY adc that i actually enjoy playing. She is also one of the only adc's that actually plays like an adc anymore. She is weak AF because she didn't get insane ability scaling like the adc's in the update and she doesn't scale with the overtuned AD caster items. The {{item:3087}} buffs helped her, but she still can't compete with all the AD casting early game adc's, that also scale really well with {{item:3153}} late. It seems like things are about to start going to calm down with the {{champion:51}} and {{item:3153}} nerfs tho. But dear god tris is fine kit wise.
TIL that Caitlyn, Jinx, Ashe, Varus, Kogmaw don't play like ADCs

Jinx and ashe do. cait is all about spamming aids AF traps and headshot. They buffed the f$ck out of her head shot and her Q to make her much less auto reliant. kog is kog. He's auto reliant and more adc like, but he has alot of caster tendencies as well as being more like a stationary turret when autoing than the "typical" adc playstyle of tris, jinx, ashe, old cait, old vayne, twitch(before Armor pen took off) imo

Her headshot is still an auto attack. Her traps are optomized if you weave them between attacks.
Kogmaw is as much a stationary turret as any other adc. If you can orb walk on jinx, you can do it on kog too.
Old twitch only built youmouu's because of the active synergy with his Q and ult for the super burst.

I'm really not sure what you define as the "typical" adc playstyle.

It's a minor difference for some, but its about adc's going from substitution/augmenting their autos with abilities to now where it's more substituting abilities with autos if that makes sense. Cait is technically still auto reliant, but her rework was all about making her an ability spammer over straight auting ie. Insane amount of AD ratios, spam traps, Q dmg up(full dmg to trapped targets so that they Q before the headshot), and head-shot(buffed an insane amount) now tied to her aids AF traps and E. I like her head shot mechanic overall, but the way it's implemented is cancerous.
They were almost gonna do a similar thing with jinx(thank GOD they didn't). They wanted to make her W crit so that she was insensitivized  to cast W rather than auto attack in a fight, instead of using it as long range poke to catch/reveal people so that she can follow with autos.

If you actually Q in a team fight on caitlyn, you will lose out on SOOO much damage.
That change only helped her out in the laning phase where she was already dominant.
Good cait's were already dropping traps before fights, now it is simply more clear that you SHOULD do it for the ones who were bad with her.
i don't think you read my suggestion all i said was increase her bomb damage to towers, no kit change at all just a numbers increase to add flavour
my Bad i didn't read all the way through and misunderstood. It's honestly {{champion:115}} that takes over that niche since he not only does it better, but can also compete with other ADC's in lane.
why can't we have an ap and ad who both do the job?

I never said "we couldn't". i think ziggs W execute was a bad idea from the start, but it took a lot longer for people to start abusing it than i thought. IMO it should work similar to how {{champion:268}} W used to work. The problem as i see it is that {{champion:115}} is going bot. Why take a tower destroying adc bot when you can take a mage that does the same job, better, and MUCH more reliably? Well i mean play ziggs sup lol but that hasn't caught on... yet lol
I play Ziggs sup and my friend goes Tristana bot. We take towers like nobody's business
http://i.imgur.com/Lrao7nD.gifv
Ziggs mid and tristana bot.

I think her niche is that she has the best self peel out of all marksmen. If your team is full engage but the enemy have divers and you want to be kinda safe go for Tristana. If you have say Leona , Sona, Soraka, Blitzcrank etc... go for Tristana.

The problem with her self peel is simple. If Jinx throws out her E and an enemy runs into it, Jinx has a second or two to auto them or for her team to follow up on that CC. If Tristana jumps from someone she's now safe but she also has no retaliation, if she ults them then she's not only pushing them out of her face but away from herself and her allies attacking them.

That's the huge double edged sword to Tristana's safety, yes she has safety but unlike every other ADC, her safety comes at the cost of her losing damage.
This all depends on how far Tristana jumps and how close the enemy is when she casts ult.

her niche is that she melts turrets faster than them. You pick Trist because you want someone who takes turrets fast and has a pretty good late game to boot. Sorry but she doesn't need more damage to turrets

She may barely beat Jinx in turret time, but she definitely doesn't beat jinx in pushing power since she has no way to clear the minion wave. If you E the wave you simply won't have it for the tower whereas Jinx can use Fishbones and kill the entire wave in 3 autos and then cut through the turret like its nothing with Pow-Pow.

Also, Ziggs does outright beat her bot lane if you REALLY want someone to take towers for your team and he also doesn't have the lack of waveclear problem.
ziggs and jinx may take towers faster, but they are nowhere near as safe while doing it... so her niche would be the "safe-siege" champion
Jinx actually mathematically takes turrets faster than Tristana.

I knew they were close I didn't know who was actually in front. My point still stands that Jinx will still push faster if left to her own devices. That being said, Trist is arguably better at seiging since her tower damage is all burst (E+2-3 autos will outdamage Jinx's 3-4 autos or whatever in the same time frame), but that still doesn't justify picking her for that niche while Jinx exists since Jinx is ultimately a better champion in most scenarios if they don't have like 3 divers.

she can push turrets slightly better but all of them still do it well enough that it doesn't matter, she isn't like ziggs where if you leave her with a turret for 5 seconds its just dead. She also is pretty low tier and her late game is worst than all the other hyper carries, even though she is supposed to be one of them. In a push situation where you won a fight jinx is the better person for pushing, the only situation she has an edge is sieging, but if the turret falls jinx could allow you to start a winning team fight, if they have alot of wave clear kog, can attack the turret from farther and not have to risk himself. She has no reason to be picked. I could be wrong and changing her in another way could work fine but right now she does not have a good niche

Except she doesn't. Someone did the math and Jinx takes turrets faster than Tristana and unlike Tristana, Jinx doesn't need to use her big source of damage (Tristana's E) to damage a turret and then have that source on cd so she can't use it on an enemy.

Her main problem is her damage ratios are weird. If her AP ratios got hammered and they added a AD ratio to her ult and jump she would see more play. 

Also her passive on her e makes CSing difficult. If they added that passive to her q active it would make more sense. Maybe make champions that died while q is active explode in a bigger radius for more damage
i still dont get it why she has ap ratios, maybe for rageblade build idk. No one builds any ap on her nowdays.

She is an older champion and they just kind of left the ratios there. The reason a lot of the roster has "meh" AP ratios to begin with was for synergy with Trinity and they just haven't gone back to change it since there isn't AP on Trinity anymore (looking at champs like Vi, Quinn before her rework, etc.).
it also makes her terrible to lane as when ahead or behind as you cant freeze and it makes last hitting under turret difficult at times.

The problem with Tristana is that when her Q is down she has one of the slowest attack speeds in the game for a marksman and that only one of her abilities has AD scalling.

She was actually stronger before she received her VGU, having higher range (safer) and more natural attack speed (less CD dependent), despite the lack of AD scalling in her kit at the time (her E still had great base damage).

Now she just feels lackluster until late game and even then, she feels weaker compared to an actual hyper carry.

She does *not* actually have less range than the ones you mentioned. At level 18, Tristana has the highest range of any AD, Jinx, Kog, and Cait all included. She also has a very clear defined niche to me; she is the safest and best self peeling hyper carry. She has fine DPS in teamfights and her reset is way more useful than Jinx's for chasing people into a losing teamfight and she has way more mobility than Jinx could ever dream of. There was a time, before they continued to flood the meta with hyper carries to take her spot, that she was *the* best hyper carry that could exist.

And as a Tristana Main, I *want* her to stay as a hyper carry. :/ To me, her identity has *always* been super safe, long ranged late game ADC; the tower taking bullshit is honestly secondary and I have no interest in her being turned into a tower taking bot.
